intro: Cyclea tonkinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate and have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers range in color from white to purple. Cyclea tonkinensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
